issues.description: The problem statement's Part 2 description incorrectly says that each PersonController method takes a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter (copy/paste from Note controller) while referring to persons in the surrounding text. This contradicts the template and solution, which both declare the controller methods with Consumer<List<Person>>. This typo can confuse students about the expected type for the callback parameter when implementing the PersonController methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement text to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> (instead of Consumer<List<Note>>) so it matches the template and solution. For example, change "Each method takes a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter" to "Each method takes a Consumer<List<Person>> parameter" and update the explanatory sentence to state that the consumer receives the internal list of persons.
